timeline.message: Display collection id in search results

* Index collection id
* Don't display collection id if there isn't one, or any coll info if record is a collection

* Index collection id
* Don't display collection id if there isn't one, or any coll info if record is a collection

timeline.bodyText: You could keep using resourceType instead of going back to briefObject.getResourceType()
timeline.author: bbpennel

replies.bodyText: weird, not sure why I did that
replies.author: lfarrell

timeline.bodyText: I don't see <h1> being used on the other record pages for the title, they seem to be doing h2. Also, I think this should be briefObject.title? Unless briefObject is actually just the title in this case unlike the others
timeline.author: bbpennel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -22,6 +22,7 @@ <%@ taglib uri="http://java.sun.com/jsp/jstl/functions" prefix="fn" %> <%@ taglib prefix="cdr" uri="http://cdr.lib.unc.edu/cdrUI"%>
+

${briefObject}

replies.bodyText: Whoops, shouldn't be there. I was just using it as a quick way to see what was in briefObject
replies.author: lfarrell

timeline.bodyText: I think a bunch of the processing in this class was written against any older version of jdom. These days you can store List<Element> directly from getChildren rather than having to cast things below. Same could be said for almost all the other extract methods in this class though.
timeline.author: bbpennel

timeline.bodyText: if you only care about the first one, you could break out of the loop when it finds the collection number rather than continuing to look. In that case you wouldn't need a List either.
timeline.author: bbpennel

timeline.message:
* Clean up view page
* Remove list for finding collectionId
